climbs.name: Gentleman's Rules
climbs.fa: Hubert D'autremont, Luke Bertelsen, Matt Martinez, Cory Hanson - Oct 2018

content.description:
This route was built on proper etiquette and chivalrous acts.

 Begin with some long pulls and by navigating the large pods that get you through the first few bolts.  The holds get smaller and moves get a little more tricky as the climb ascends the blunt arete.  Solve this section and you just have to deal with the tricky and not so straight forward mantle that guards the final slab romp to the chains.  

 If you find yourself in doubt on this climb just remember, a gentleman makes it happen.
content.location: Currently the second route on the left side of The Baby Gap.

climbs.name: Critterbug
climbs.fa: Matt Martinez, Hubert D'autremont, Luke Bertelsen Oct 2018

content.description: HARD boulder problem crux off the ground leads to super techy edging and pebble wrestling on glassy limestone with dispersed chert crimps. Feet intensive beta and some of the most unique features I've ever seen. Extremely fun climbing that I wish could've gone on a little longer. Enjoy!
content.location: First route on the left when heading UP the gully. First draw has permanent chain draw. Plans to perma the second draw - recommend extending it with stick clip for now.

content.description: This is the north side of the gully that separates The Prow from the rest of the cliff band. This is separated from Mine The Gap by a saddle that allows access to the cliff top. It has shade all day save for a couple hours in the afternoon where the sun peaks into the gully. Nothing but crazy chert pulling so far, but there seems to be lots of potential here. More to come!
